website_summaries.verdict: Exceptionally designed all-weather hiking boot for women by Lowa. Now featuring a Monowrap frame construction that improves stability while reducing weight.
pros: Has a women's specific last and a stiffer shank for extra support
Vibram outsole improves grip and shock absorption
Derby-style lacing allows for customization of various widths of feet
cons: A couple reports of soles separating after minimal use

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot But Faulty Midsole
customer_reviews.text: Love the boot. However, even the manufacturer rep confirms that unless you wear it at least once per week, the polyurethane mid-sole will fall apart, which we've heard a lot of complaints about. REI boot experts says this has been a problem since the company started making the Renegade, a problem the company hasn't solved yet. This doesn't happen with EVA midsoles i.e. Vasque, which are also lighter than polyurethane. Wanted to keep the boot but just can't under these circumstances since it's not exactly cheap. Last hiking boots, which New Balance doesn't make anymore, lasted over 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Think Positive Unless Impossible

customer_reviews.title: The sole of the shoes easily get worn out
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made shoes but the sole is not. I am only 96 lbs and walking minimum 10 miles per week. The sole got worn out after 7 month of walking the sharp rocks of Hawaii. I tried to contact the seller but I realize it's a German company. I hope this review can get to them so that they can make a better sole. I bought another pair and been walking for the last 4 months and I can see the sole starting to get worn out again.
customer_reviews.author: Esther S.

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable and fit even with thicker boot socks
customer_reviews.text: The Iowa boots just arrived, and for first try-on, they are comfortable and fit even with thicker boot socks. I have very wide feet, but a narrow heel, and these fit well. Can't wait to take them out for a short hike to really test them. I have tried Keens, Merrills, and other boots and had to return them. These are the only ones with the wide foot bed, but a woman's heel. Also the ankle area padding is great! I like the looks, too.
customer_reviews.author: Shenandoah Valley Born

customer_reviews.title: Buy 'em!
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots! Wore them around town the first day just to get a feel for them. It was obvious no break in time was needed. Very comfortable. Went hiking yesterday on rocky terrain uphill and gotta say - I'm glad I purchased these. Good footing, ankle support, and my toe wasn't jabbing the front of the boot on the downhill. I've already recommended these to a couple people looking for new boots. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Diane D

customer_reviews.title: I was happy to purchase the exact same model in a stylish ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Lowa renegades. My first pair experienced sole hydrolysis that was no longer covered under warranty. That being said, I took them EVERYwhere for 10 years of travel. From Achorage to Invercargil, they were my hiking lifeblood. I was happy to purchase the exact same model in a stylish Purple, and have yet to break them in. Looking forward to another 10yrs!
customer_reviews.author: Backscheider

customer_reviews.title: WOW..great fit and comfortable right out of the box!!
customer_reviews.text: My previous boots had done me well with about 30,000 miles and I didn't know if I was going to find a boot that was as comfortable and well made. I absolutely love these boots. First day out I hiked 3 miles and everyday since, 6 miles or more. I took out the liners that came with the boots and put in my own ortho inserts since I have both knee and back issues...it was like I had been wearing them for years; no break in time needed! I hike over forested and mountain rock trails with no issues. I liked these so much I bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: L Renoir

customer_reviews.title: Tight boot with a restocking fee for return
customer_reviews.text: It was very tight on the top of the boot and fitting was to small when I was on an incline with my feet. Unfortunately after reading the return policy, the company is charging a 20% restocking fee which is really unfair when purchasing boots online. Won't buy anything from them again!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: A great boot. Felt a little tight.
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas present for my wife. This is her 5th pair of Lowa hiking boots. I ordered the exact same size and width as labeled on the tongue of her current Lowa Renegades. These have the exact same label but she says they seem a little tight. The soles look to be the same length. Three years ago Lowa seemed to change their actual dimensions. She had to move up a size to get the same fit. I hope this is not the same problem. This is Christmas morning with swollen morning feet. We will see how they test with proper socks on a walk.
customer_reviews.author: SaltydogMills

customer_reviews.title: all around great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Lowa Renegade GTX. They are a little heavy compared to many other boots, but I find they never give me blisters* and the sole has the right amount of cushy to be comfortable walking on almost any surface, whether it be concrete or earth. They are also pretty darn grippy over rock surfaces when scrambling. *about the blisters. I always wear two pairs of socks when hiking, one thin next to my feet, and one cushy, thick woolen pair. This doesn't prevent blisters - I have still gotten them in other hiking shoes. But since I said I never got blisters in these shoes, I thought I should also mention the sock thing.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Elliot

customer_reviews.title: A Hiking Boot To Love
customer_reviews.text: Only had the boots for two weeks but have already put about 100 canyon hiking miles on them. They have been comfortable since day one - needed no breaking in. No hot spots. I have to walk along the beach to get to the canyon and sometimes high tide catches me and I get soaked, so the boots have been soaked several times and very waterproof. I love them already.
customer_reviews.author: E.D.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE them. I've never owned high-end hiking boots and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots to wear for a 10 week internship in the Frank Church Wilderness. I LOVE them. I've never owned high-end hiking boots and I'm so glad I upgraded to these. They're comfortable, super water tight, and fairly breathable for being leather. They've held up very well over 2.5 years of field work, backpacking trips, and hikes. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Jossie

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but a bit stiff in the sole ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, but a bit stiff in the sole and at the ankle when wearing for long hikes when visiting Tucson. The soles were a bit too slippery on large smooth rocks. I did not lace the top laces as they were a bit too uncomfortable on the front of my ankles when I did. The width is good and they seem well made, so I'm hoping for the high price to get a lot of wear out of them when I get into hiking at home.
customer_reviews.author: TaharaDancer

customer_reviews.title: I love these Lowas
customer_reviews.text: I love these Lowas. They are comfortable and give me the support I need while hiking on uneven terrain. I've have had them for a while and have not experienced any of the previously stated issues. The soles are still intact, they clean up easily. I would probably purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These Really Fit Women's Feet
customer_reviews.text: Lowas are the only hiking boots that truly fit my feet. I've tried many brands, all the usual ones. I only buy Lowas now. Everything else slides in the heel because they're not made to fit women's feet even when they say they are. Women's feet have narrow heels and wide toes and Lowas fit my feet perfectly. And well made sturdy hiking boots that are not too heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Regina Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pair of boots - multipurpose and has not let ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pair of boots - multipurpose and has not let me down no matter the circumstance - shoe size is true to normal sizes - love them - I will be wearing them in Iceland in two weeks!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Wanted the very best for my wife who recently experienced a severe ankle sprain. As indicated, these boots have very high ankle support. We hike in the 4 - 8 hr range on generally mountainous-hilly terrain so these boots get a work-out. You get what you pay for and these are the best hiking boots out there. We read the reviews and bought 1/2 size larger - they fit perfectly. Waiting for mine to wear out so that I can get the men's version !
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: ( I do love Lowa Renegade GTX Mid - the last one I ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to return this particular boots because the size was too small for my feet (a 7.5 used to fit me, but now I need an 8.5 Wide - it seems my feet expanded over time. :( I do love Lowa Renegade GTX Mid - the last one I had lasted me 10 full years, which was used mainly for international hikes in various terrains. I will still give these pair of boots a 5-star rating for its durability, its quality, its ability to withstand the test of time/terrains, its ability to keep your feet dry & blisterless and its ability to be worn ASAP without breaking it in!
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boots I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these boots for about a year and I am OBSESSED. Best hiking boots I’ve ever owned. They are so comfortable and offer great ankle support. Very sturdy soles too, I don’t feel the rocks under my feet at all. I may get insoles though as there’s not much cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: This is a repeat purchase for my wife. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a repeat purchase for my wife. I purchased the first pair in 2014. She is a postal carrier and works many many hours on walking her mail route, jumping in and out of her truck, and slushing through all kinds of weather in Colorado. The first pair lasted almost 18 months and she absolutely loves them. She has tried other boots and they just don't hold up to the constant beating and weather she has to work in. She pleaded for these as a gift...so I bought here another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOFED
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable but THEY ARE NOT WATERPROOF! You might not have this problem if you hike in long pant. I recently hiked in shorts through a persistent drizzle and my feet were soaked in no time. I thought that maybe the water got in through my socks but I did a lawn sprinkler test and the water instantly poured in through the sides of the tongue. Will have to wear gaiters with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Kokolii

customer_reviews.title: Ecstatic about my new hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so comfortable, warm, and wind-resistant. I bought them for my hiking/backpacking trips because I read great reviews about them on some gear reviews website, and as these were the best all around pick, they have yet to disappoint me. I`ve been wearing them around town in the cold weather to test them out warmth-wise, and to break themin, but they don`t seem to need breaking in at all, and they are astounding at keeping my feet warm and cozy (I can literally say these are my most comfortable shoes). They are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Can't go higher on ratings as haven't worn m now than twice. So far feels good. Toe box is roomy and let's foot expand without pinching or rubing and lace up system is one of better ones I've used. Fits snug to ankle for support & keeps boot stable to foot. Heat so far on first hour long walk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Especially for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased two pair of the Lowa S-Cruise Mesh Hiking Shoes and loved the support and durability. The Renegade doesn't fit as well and has minimal arch support. It seems almost boxy for a hiking shoe. I also don't care for the grommet lacing system compared to traditional lacing. You have to maintain a pulling tension while lacing at the same time. I will be returning. This boot has very LITTLE arch support/padding which is needed and expected from this brand and type of boot especially considering the price. I've purchased other Lowa shoes that are much better!
customer_reviews.author: melomalo

customer_reviews.title: Purple was her favorite color
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for an ex-girlfriend, and they lasted longer than our relationship. She still wears ‘em.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Foerster

customer_reviews.title: They were wonderful. Walked across a shallow river bed and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I wore them on a 4 mile hike, just to break them in. They were wonderful. Walked across a shallow river bed and they kept water out. Used Injinji 2.0 men's liner crew toe socks (mens, but I'm a female and they worked great!) to help with any blisters or rubbing. My feet feel great and no issues! Guessing it was a combination of the socks and boots. Will take this combination on a weekend hike coming up!
customer_reviews.author: Haley0584

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable hiker
customer_reviews.text: Have hiked a couple hundred miles in these since I bought them last year and they are worth the investment. Not too heavy, great ankle support, and a fantastic grip that allowed me to hike through many rainy days with no worries about wet leaves or rocks. I average 5-7 miles per day, but have done 11 miles at a stretch in these with no discomfort. Will be buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: jla22

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy and have good ankle support which is essential for ...
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy and have good ankle support which is essential for me. The arch support is not as good as I wanted, but I am using innersoles for that. They are still a little stiff, but they are becoming MY shoes. I have wide feet and had difficult finding ones. But they are just right width. I have not tried in rain, but they did well in dews. I am wearing every day since it is Spring at last!
customer_reviews.author: eyeball

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, be prepared to protect your investment with proper storage and upkeep
customer_reviews.text: Been breaking them in slowly, very comfy with good support so far. I ordered a half size larger and wider so I could wear thick winter socks and an extra insert. The directions give instructions on how to store and care for the boots after hiking - airing out and cleaning to keep the surfaces of the shoes functional - i.e. leather soft so it won't crack, waterproofing , etc.- will clearly take some work and attention to storage conditions to extend the life of any leather boot. Instructions were translated from German so some bizarre wording, but sounds like standard upkeep stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Knox Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great boot. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. Unfortunately, I couldn't wear it because it was too small. I gave it away because I wore it once on a hiking trip, and I didn't think I could return it. I ordered a size larger, which fits jut right.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Marin

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking shoes I've ever owned. Fantastic quality , attractive style, supportive and very comfortable right out of the box. I am a women's size 9 and I purchased a 9 medium width; the fit is great. I have been on some short 3-5 mile hikes, since purchasing and they are very comfortable. I'm in Northern Minnesota and today I paired them with some nice wool hiking socks and took a 3 mile hike in below zero temps; my feet stayed nice and warm the whole time. Love these and so very happy I went with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like The Fit
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit very well. They're plenty wide for a women's boot. I'll be able to wear a thick sock and an orthotic if I need to. Ankle support, not as good as the Salomon's, the tongue is really thick. I think they will do well for snow hiking so I'm gonna keep them.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Woman

customer_reviews.title: love em
customer_reviews.text: these boots are generous in the width and toes. They are warm but not a snow boot. Best to waterproof them with a spray before wearing. They have nice vibram soles that last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: KodiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe - why is there a little crack in the leather?
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the best. Had them before and will buy them again probably. However, on this pair I have a little crack in the leather after just 2 weeks hiking. Never had that before. Will need to see if it will affect further use. Otherwise I am sure Lowa will keep-up its reputation and replace this if faulty. Oh, the color is realy nice for girls, kind of old pink to red color. My wife loves that the most!!
customer_reviews.author: Bear grills survival gerber

customer_reviews.title: Lowa's for life
customer_reviews.text: I went to a summit hut store where I live and tried on a few different pairs of hiking boots and loved these but was not going to pay the $230 for them amazon is always my go too if I think something is priced to high and sure enough, they had them and in my size for $168 at the time! I was thrilled! These are great boots and so comfortable! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Lulubabyface

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: These Lowas replaced a pair of Lowa hiking boots I had and loved for almost 15 years. The fit is perfect for my feet,roomy in the front,as hiking boots should be,without being too big. The prune color is just beautiful. Also I am able to wear my orthotics in them comfortably. I look forward to years of happy hiking feet.
customer_reviews.author: LOUIS R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars for Style and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: These boots are comfortable, beautiful and stylish. I wore them to climb Machu Picchu and they were great to climb through tough terrain and stone structures. Looking forward to many more hiking adventures with these awesome boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous, out of the box comfortable. Attractive, light weight with good support. Made all the difference in my hiking experience. My feet have gotten wider with age--the wider toe box was just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: CoolGrandma

customer_reviews.title: Great boot second time around
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of this same boot back around 2000 when we lived on the west coast. This year they gave up the ghost. The ones I had fit well, accommodated new foot beds, and then later my orthotics. So I ordered another pair, I though briefly about calling the company, but really who complains about a 14 year old boot that's walked around the world? The new ones came and the fit was perfect, they are comfortable everywhere. I have very picky feet anything that rubs or wears on my foot is an immediate rejection. I couldn't be happier. Off to trek the earth some more.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. Briand

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I was unprepared for how comfortable these boots are. I can wear them all day easily. They were supposed to be my "winter weather" shoes, but I have worn them well past our rainy season. I've worn them in Disneyland and even in Las Vegas in triple digit heat. My favorite part? No aching joints (hips, knees, ankles) even after all day on my feet in lines and walking around.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: You like to walk or hike, or take your dog for a walk on the beach in the winter, getting wet, you won't ever have to clean them
customer_reviews.text: Womens boots. Hike, A walk in the winter with your dog in snow, in the woods, in the summer hiking, support that will keep your back and knees from any pain. No breaking in needed, and they are as sparkling clean as the day I bought them. You waste your money on cheaper pairs, then you will end up buying three pairs in a year, and these have lasted five years, I'm set. So I had to buy them as the perfect gift.
customer_reviews.author: Norwaygirl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these hiking boots! I've tried various brands over the years, but these are the first boots that fit well right from the start. Never had a single blister!
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: these boots are tried and true
customer_reviews.text: i love Lowa and how well they fit and how comfortable they are from the moment you begin wearing them...my last pair lasted 10 years or more...and only recently came to their final end...i find these new ones a nice change even tho the same brand and model...but i'm tempted to try out a different pair of boots as these are "slow"...meaning all function no pizazz...and i might need a change...and hope i won't regret it if i do b/c i KNOW these are great!
customer_reviews.author: J. Elizabeth Dousson

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought Lowa hiking shoes ten years ago and finally wore them out; I replaced those with the mid hiking. Comfortable right out of the box! I highly recommending this brand-very worth the money. Super comfortable and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would buy the narrow size again
customer_reviews.text: These boots are lightweight, supportive and I love the lacing system. I have narrow feet and have a very hard time finding boots or shoes to fit well. These fit my narrow feet perfectly at the size I usually wear.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna E.

customer_reviews.title: Lowa Renegade Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: My entire family goes hiking and backpacking. I guess that's because we are all involved in Boy Scouts! Recently, my wife told me that her old hiking boots were starting to fall apart. Immediately, I got the hint. Researched the web for the best hiking boots for my price range. We then went to REI to confirm my wife's shoe size and width. Went back on the web to research and find her a great hiking boot. Found it! Bought it. Now my life is happy, 'cause my wife is happy.
customer_reviews.author: GR Isidro

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Boot That Fits Narrow Feet!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the women's 11 narrow and I think they will be fine. I have worn them around the house and plan on keeping them. I do feel they will need some break in before I go on a long hike. They are just a tiny bit wide but I think I just have to wear a thicker sock. Lovely boots and they look very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie

customer_reviews.title: Lowa lightweight, great fit
customer_reviews.text: I usually would not buy footwear online, as I have a fairly narrow foot and dont like sloppy fit. Fortunately a friend had researched and purchased Lowa boots, and recommended them to me. The fit is perfect, no hot spots, no sloppiness, and they are very lightweight, and waterproof (maybe water resistant, but I have not suffered any leaks yet.) Super happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Pamskis2

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots!! They are perfect for hiking in the desert. Rocks can break down the stability. It will take a long time in these. They are comfortable right out of the box. No breaking in time needed... Great colors too! I ordered the Gray. Many compliments on this color..
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots, I only wish I could have kept ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots, I only wish I could have kept them, although I ordered wide, they were way too snug across the toes, had t return them.
customer_reviews.author: Carol C.

customer_reviews.title: amazing boots.
customer_reviews.text: i love these boots. this was the second pair i bought.. i used the first pair for 8 years. i did have them repaired once or twice but come on 8 years is a GREAT run for hiking boots. LOVE THEM... will buy them as long as they make them. my ankles feel truly supported. im sure these boots have saved my life on more than one occasion.
customer_reviews.author: E Drag

customer_reviews.title: Lowa Women's Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these blindly from Amazon Warehouse Deals. They looked like new. I plan to wear them around the house and to work on dress down day to get used to them before hiking next month. I hadn't heard of this brand but for the most part the reviews were very favorable.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hook

customer_reviews.title: Wides are not that wide.
customer_reviews.text: I think that these shoes are fairly high quality shoes. I ordered a Wide because I have wide feet but after just 2 hours of hiking a light trail, my feet were hurting from both shoes! I had on hiking socks. Going to try with a thinner sock and I had done some stretching to see if that will help. For now, I bring a back up pair of shoes until I'm confident that they won't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find a woman's hiking boot in a wide width. It fits fine with good wool hiking socks and doesn't press on the outside of my foot; for that, I am grateful. I've worn a pair of boots with this same type of sole for at least 10 years while caving and it has held up through mud and continuous drenching in streams. I expect these will be just as serviceable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bazar

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Lowa boots. I had a pair in a standard width size 9 that were sneaker comfy but foot problems made them feel more tight across the toes. I found them in the wide width and decided to give them a try. Still sneaker comfy, but I would have likes them to be a tiny bit wider at the toe box. My little toes still feel slightly squished, but there is a little more room than in the standard width. I do wish Lowa made the purple or navy in wide width too.
customer_reviews.author: Avia M. Rauscher

customer_reviews.title: The best hiking shoes everrr:)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my backpacking around Europe. My size is 8.5 and ordered for true size:) Seriously I love wearing it!!! Looks cool Stylish No pain at all Fit perfectly Pricey but very worth it The best hiking shoes ever
customer_reviews.author: Eric Berglund

customer_reviews.title: Truly Red
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I LOVE THESE BOOTS!! Red is my signature color. This is my second pair of boots from Lowa and I absolutely love them. I'm an avid hiker and had taken a hiatus for many months due to injuries. Someone started talking about hiking on a Friday afternoon in the office, I found these on Amazon, ordered overnight shipping and had them Saturday afternoon in plenty of time for my 9 mile hike on Sunday. This brand is known for its wear and go comfort and I can attest to that. I wear Size 5 in street shoes and knew a 5.5 would be perfect for trail. Would never hesitate to buy Lowa.
customer_reviews.author: Pegg

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Winter Walkers
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much that I bought a backup pair in another color, so I would never be without them. They are exceptionally lightweight, and lace up in a flash. They give my toes lots of room, and don't slip up and down on my heels. Then of course, they're waterproof! Unless you need more of a fashion statement in your boots, these are fabulous. They even make my feel look smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Morningglory

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these so much. I could wear them every day all day. Highly recommend. They are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Licausi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Lowas years ago and they finally died after around 15 years. I never conditioned them yet they stayed waterproof thru their lifetime. I needed new boots and these were almost identical to the ones I had so I bought these. They fit exactly like my old ones, comfortable right out of the box. I was so happy to get them I started wearing them a lot. They are great boots and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: rocketdogmom

customer_reviews.title: These are really great hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: These are really great hiking boots! I have gone on several hikes in various terrain from plains to steep climbs to muddy bogs and they've been great. Very waterproof on the wet hike we did. I purchased a wide (i'm often in between needing a medium and a wide), these worked out well for me. I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable boot
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair of Renegades that I have had. They wear well and provide good support. I have worn one pair out and have studded my 2nd pair for winter. These new ones fit just as well as the older ones with no real break-in needed.
customer_reviews.author: Andi Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Best rough terrain hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Best rough terrain hiking boot. Can handle rocks & roots with out slipping or worry about ankle sprain. I find it cooler than most gore-tex boots and could wear it all day. Like a lot of hiking boots it seems narrow in the toe box especially with heavy socks, but Lowa makes a wide version unlike competitors. The Mercedes of hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: PENNY GIRL

customer_reviews.title: Why did Lowa change the last for women's boots????
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Lowa for years....totally a favorite and have fit perfectly. These have a different last, and I may return them. Trying to make them fit as well as the old Lowa boots. Heel is thinner, as is the entire sole...... Liked the idea of red boots, so I am not sure what I will do yet! Aaah, if only manufacturers would leave a good product alone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this boot
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this boot! 100% lives up to their name and reputation as the best in the market. I broke these boots in on an 18-mile hike in the Desolation Wilderness on very rugged terrain and had almost zero foot and leg fatigue. I purchased a size larger than my street shoe size and used a good insert, and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Blocker

customer_reviews.title: These boots are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered wide because I wear orthotics in my boot, they are a little big, but with thick socks work well. The laces don't tighten enough around the top to help support my ankle, but it's not enough of an issue to return them. They are very comfortable, all I have to do now is walk over some rocks and see how they support my ankles!
customer_reviews.author: AZ dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to replace my beloved Vasque Breeze, which no longer come in narrow. This boot is lighter, which is great, and higher around the ankle, which I'm not sure about yet. So far they seem to be fine but I have yet to see what their performance is on a steep trail or in water. It took Amazon over 3 weeks to get them to me, however. When Amazon works it works well. But when there's a screw up they're a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. I feel like I can slay dragons when I wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this boot now for about five to six hikes - day hikes up to five miles and one very short overnight with only about 20 lb. pack. It fits very well on my narrow-ish foot, a little snug where my right bunion is, but still allows me to spread out my toes. Ankle stays put, is very well supported. Comfortable. Waterproof, wading through streams up to the cuff is no problem! Nice grip on rocks, some sliding in very loose dusty soil on the steeps - I like this boot a lot. Can't speak to the durability yet, but the fit out of the box is great and the comfort and support are nice. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justice for All

customer_reviews.title: Lowa is a good company to look at
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife who has very narrow feet. For those women who need a narrow shoe, Lowa is a good company to look at. However, my wife found the boot to be "big". Not necessarily heavy but less flexible and more for extended backpacking trips than 3 or 4 hour day hikes. Otherwise sizing was fairly accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable all around walking boot
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable all around walking boot, waterproof and excellent tread. Does not look clunky. Lasts for years. Fast service.
customer_reviews.author: BONNIE REMICK

customer_reviews.title: They are pretty light weight and as long as water doesn't creep ...
customer_reviews.text: I have troubles with blisters, EVERYWHERE on my feet in most hikers. I had a pair of asolos for 6+ years and still would get blisters if I wore them over and hour. I tried every sock you can imagine and nothing helped. These however have been on a few trips in the mountains and so far not a single blister! They are pretty light weight and as long as water doesn't creep in the top of the boot my feet stay nice and dry. The only thing is that in the summer months my feet felt a little warm. Overall comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Kick @$$, look good, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Who knew the most comfortable footwear in my 50 plus years would come in the form of boots? For all my life, the very first thing I do when I get home has been take off my shoes. I sometimes don't even think about that for hours with these. I purchased the Renegade GTX boots for outdoor activities, but they immediately became every day shoes. They look great with jeans or khakis. I'm happy to have found these!
customer_reviews.author: Lyric Crossborn

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable and fit perfectly. They did not cause any blistering or hot spots and didn't need any break in period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Fit perfectly, and are very comfortable. Made very well. I have 3 pair, now. I don't hike much but I live in a rural area, the clean up well. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: CinciChar

customer_reviews.title: My favorite hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: My favorite hiking boots, I love them. I have usernames them on easy to hard hikes the boots are great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I ordered half size up, in C/D and it was way too narrow. Gave it three stars though because they are much much cuter in person than I expected. Seems like a really great rugged boot that would last long. But I won't know as I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: SeekUp Grasshopper

customer_reviews.title: Best boot ever...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these boots. My feet no longer hurt at the end of the day, even if working on concrete. Great boot for hiking, walking long distances or standing. Comfortable, the wide boot is wide in the right places, the height is perfect for ankle support without rubbing. And they breathe, so hot weather's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bar 7R Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Solid boot
customer_reviews.text: I ordered up half a size based on other comments, and they fit just fine. Construction and comfort were good. I like the fact that they have seven lacing points, so they can be securely laced, tighter or loser on top and bottom. I have bunions, and they would have been okay but not great. I kept the Salomon Quest 4d because they fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and comfortable in all weather
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the investment! My feet stay dry, warm, and comfortable in all weather. Absolutely recommend these for everything from yard work or light hiking to multi-day backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear 6 Wide, but, I ordered 5.5 Wide (based on the suggestion option on Amazon). Length was good, but, width was still too narrow; I felt if I went up to 6 Wide, the shoes would be too long but not wide enough so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Zinfendel

customer_reviews.title: Best investment
customer_reviews.text: These boots were ready to go out of the box. I wore them on a little hike that included small stream crossing (about 3 inches of water and my feet stayed dry) and walking up a lot of steep steps and into a cave. I went a half a size up from what I normally wear in case I wanted to add socks and the boots run true to size. I had no blisters and my feet were not sore after my hike. They are lighter than my last pair of boots. I highly recommend these boots. I hike the Ozarks in Missouri and Arkansas.
customer_reviews.author: April R. Kastning

customer_reviews.title: Great color. Not too loud
customer_reviews.text: Great color. Not too loud, but not dull either. And the fit. Lowa's are the best as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Truthfinder

customer_reviews.title: I purchased them for a trip to Colorado and they did not disappoint. I wear them on a regular basis as ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m absolutely loving these hiking boots. I purchased them for a trip to Colorado and they did not disappoint. I wear them on a regular basis as I am an avid hiker. Another plus other than comfort is the red color I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OMG these are awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I put these on my feet I wore them for a 16 mile overnight hike over 3 peaks and 4100 vertical feet with a 35 lb pack on my back. I didn't get one blister. They are comfortable, lightweight, weather resistant, great on rocks and slippery surfaces, everything I wanted in a hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Great boots all around & they fit well
customer_reviews.text: Great boots all around & they fit well. I wore my other pair down after having them for years and didn't hesitate to buy another pair of Lowas mainly because they are extremely light and keep my feet dry.

customer_reviews.title: He's are wonderful boots. I only had a little soreness around ...
customer_reviews.text: He's are wonderful boots. I only had a little soreness around the ankles because I'm not used to mid height boots. I had great arch support but that's because I put in my own arches so I can't judge the originals. They look very sturdy and feel very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Heiner

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, they don't rub
customer_reviews.text: These shoes got me through Patagonian mountains. Doesn't hold you back, feels light but they're tough. Great shoes, they don't rub, they'll last you forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not even a little wide.
customer_reviews.text: Of all the wide boots I've tried these were by far the narrowest. They even looked like Victorian replicas of boots. Oow. Otherwise they seemed to be a nice boot. People who need wide shoes want super wide....
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of these boots. They're comfortable, light-weight, available in my long, narrow size, and require minimal breaking in, if any. My only objection is that the stitching eventually gives out where the ball of my foot bends. This may be because of the toe styling, which may also be why they're so comfortable. I've been able to repair them with Shoe Goo until the soles are pretty well worn down too,at which time I buy another pair just like them.
customer_reviews.author: Clancy'sMom

customer_reviews.title: Love these hiking boots, great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing for all my hikes for almost six years - hiking at least once & maximum 6 hikes a week. Good grip, water proof, not willing to throw away until the sole eroded both on the side & back. Love it, love it.... It looks super cool when it was new, look nice to match with all activewear even not for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Wong

customer_reviews.title: Best made boots I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Best made boots I ever bought...BUT had to return them, there is zero arch support. I wore them for a half hour and my feet and back ached.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Lowa is still the Leader
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, and she has nothing but great things to say about this shoes. Comfortable from day one, light weight, nice looking, color scheme is perfect that the shoes never looks dirty. All in all it is one of thouse things that are a little expensive but is actually well worth it even more.
customer_reviews.author: E Z Long Beach

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 pair
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I have pain in my legs and feet so I need support and comfort, these boots offer both.
customer_reviews.author: What's up with that?

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. First pair got used up trekking through Nepal and Amazon jungles. I love them. Can't recommend them highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Gal

customer_reviews.title: They fit great. I have wide feet
customer_reviews.text: They fit great. I have wide feet. 6D. They feel great. Waterproof. But they are super hot. I can only wear these on the cold days. Going to have to find a different boot for spring and summer.
customer_reviews.author: EmChampion

customer_reviews.title: Trying to choose between Keen and Lowa for Camino walk
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keen Targhee boots for a year. They are so soft and comfortable that I wondered if a sturdier boot would be more appropriate for hundreds of miles. The Lowa is definitely harder but since they were too small I didn't get to give them a good trial. I will replace them with the correct size and write another review later.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K. Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Long time wearer or this boot!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this same boot for about 30 years and have always liked them. Good for light hiking, wading through water, good grip on rocks and boulders, good for any terrain actually. I wear a narrow and was happy when they started carrying narrow sizes although I did wear the medium until narrow came out. I wish it was a more cushioned boot, but liked this boot so much I never tried any other brand, I just use a Spenco comfort sole (thin enough to not make the boot tight) and change out when I need a bit more cushion.
customer_reviews.author: thedogmom

customer_reviews.title: Narrowest Hiking Boots I Have Found
customer_reviews.text: I had been trying to get narrow hiking boots for about a year in Australia without success. I have a farm and work in the boots all day. I have a 10AA to 10AAA size foot and these are the narrowest boots I have been able to find. I ordered a second pair soon after the first ones arrived in case something happened and I couldn't get them again. If Lowa ever make 10AAA I would buy them straight away as they are a very good quality hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing after hearing how great Lowa boots are
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed after hearing great reviews about how comfortable they would be and not having to break them in. During a two hour walk they were killing me. Blisters on my toes and my feet felt like they were on fire. I was fitted in an outdoor shop then bought the same size online
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wore the day I received and it was like I had worn them everyday!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable and well worth the money. My husband and I both purchased the same shoe types and loved that there is no break-in period. Fit like a glove with great ankle support. No hot spots or blisters and we hiked for 20 miles in the mountains. A must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

product_meta.title: Lowa Women's Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot
product_meta.description:
Ideal for day hikes and short-haul weekend pack trips, the LOWA Renegade GTX Hiking Boot combines versatility with comfort. Featuring a moisture-wicking footbed, full-length nylon shank, and shock-absorbent Vibram sole, these all-terrain hiking boots are designed to support lightweight packs up to 25 pounds.

WOMEN'S RENEGADE GTX 
MID HIKING BOOT
AT A GLANCE:
 * All-terrain, GORE-TEX waterproof, breathable hiking boots for day hikes and light backpacking
 * Climate-control footbed wicks away moisture for comfort
 * Durable Monowrap frame reduces boot weight
 * Full-length nylon shank for stability
 * Rugged Vibram outsole helps maintain grip

RENEGADE GTX Mid
This hiking boot features waterproof GORE-TEX lining that reduces hot spots so your feet stay comfortable.
View larger.

The Renegade's nubuck leather upper securely holds the foot in place, reducing strain on the toes during downhill sections. View larger.

FEATURES LEATHER UPPER, LIGHTWEIGHT MIDSOLE, AND
VIBRAM OUTSOLE
The Renegade's nubuck leather upper securely holds the foot in place, reducing strain on the toes during downhill sections. Its Monowrap midsole technology reduces overall boot weight, while providing extra cushioning and lateral stability. A rugged Vibram outsole and thick, nonslip rubber lugs make these boots ideal for hiking, light backpacking, and other outdoor activities where you need traction and grip. This shoe is built on gender-specific, men's and women's lasts, for optimal fit and comfort. 

CLIMATE-CONTROL FOOTBED WICKS AWAY MOISTURE
 The Renegade boot features a climate-control footbed which keeps your feet cool, dry, and blister free. Perforations in the boot's lining allow air to circulate and wick moisture away from your foot, minimizing friction and fatigue. 

WATERPROOF GORE-TEX KEEPS FEET DRY
 Renegade boots with the GTX designation--including the Renegade II GTX LO and Renegade GTX Mid--feature breathable, waterproof GORE-TEX lining that reduces hot spots so your feet stay comfortable in warmer temperatures as well as cold, wet conditions. Renegade boots with the LL designation feature buttery-soft glove leather lining that molds to the contours of your feet for exceptional comfort. 

STABILIZING SHANKS AND DERBY-STYLE LACING
 These hiking boots feature a full-length nylon shank for extra stability on rugged terrain. Also, the derby-style lacing on the Renegade Mid boots ensures a customized fit for a wide variety of feet. 

ABOUT LOWA
 Handcrafted in Europe for close to 90 years, LOWA boots have been acclaimed by climbers, mountaineers, and hikers as the finest outdoor boots in the world. LOWA incorporates thoughtful design and superb materials with clean, environmental manufacturing processes and fair labor standards. When you own a pair of LOWAs, you can be confident you're wearing authentic outdoor footwear that "walks the talk" when it comes to quality, performance, and sustainability. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
LOWA Women's Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot.

RENEGADE COLLECTION
Men's Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot

Women's Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot

Men's Renegade II GTX LO Hiking Shoe

Women's Renegade II GTX LO Hiking Shoe

Men's Renegade II Leather-Lined Mid Hiking Boot

Women's Renegade II Leather-Lined Mid Hiking Boot

Men's Renegade II LL Low Hiking Boot

Women's Renegade II LL Low Hiking Boot

TRADEMARK INFORMATION:
PU Monowrap® Frame

GORE-TEX®

Vibram® Evo



For close to 90 years, LOWA boots have been acclaimed by climbers, mountaineers and hikers as the finest outdoor boots in the world. Every LOWA boot is handcrafted in Europe, where they incorporate the elements of thoughtful design, superb materials, clean manufacturing processes and fair labor standards. When you own a pair of LOWAs, you can be confident that you're wearing authentic outdoor footwear that "walks the talk" when it comes to quality, performance and sustainability.
feature_bullets: Leather hiking boot with corded lace-up vamp and speed-lacing grommets at top
